qas.question: What did the Turkish troops capture first on the island?
What was the date of the second Turkish invasion?
What locations were seized in the second invasion?

answers.text: Morphou, Karpass, Famagusta and the Mesaoria

context: Three days later, when a ceasefire had been agreed, Turkey had landed 30,000 troops on the island and captured <a0_0>Kyrenia<a0_0/>, the corridor linking Kyrenia to Nicosia, and the Turkish Cypriot quarter of Nicosia itself. The junta in Athens, and then the Sampson regime in Cyprus fell from power. In Nicosia, Glafkos Clerides assumed the presidency and constitutional order was restored, removing the pretext for the Turkish invasion. But after the peace negotiations in Geneva, the Turkish government reinforced their Kyrenia bridgehead and started a second invasion on <a1_0>14 August<a1_0/>. The invasion resulted in the seizure of <a2_0>Morphou, Karpass, Famagusta and the Mesaoria<a2_0/>.
